attributes.action: Amend the Health & Social Care Act 2012 S75 to end outsourcing of NHS contracts
attributes.additional_details:
NHS managers & employees at all levels, Unite & GMB, & patients have all said that the requirement to put out to tender must be removed. It’s time for the government to listen to the experts & the public & take action. We demand that the Secretary of State for Health and Social Care, Matt Hancock, block the sell-off.

"The rules on competition introduced by the HSC Act were called ‘the motor of NHS privatisation’"

http://www.patients4nhs.org.uk/private-companies-involvement-in-the-nhs/
attributes.background: The Health and Social Care Act  2012 S75 requires that NHS England Clinical Commissioning Groups must put out to tender any contract worth over £615,000 - even if the NHS manages the service efficiently. Services that deliver the best care for patients are being taken over & run for private profit.
